Review: This show is ridiculous and unconvincing. Dialogues are awful, acting is bad and the script is insulting viewer's intelligence. Mother's secrets could have been a great show for itself and are, along with the island flashbacks the only reason I'm still watching. The bad guys and villains aren't scary at all, action scenes aren't exciting, some of the actors have a charisma of a cooked octopus when they're trying to be tough; that's actually funny from time to time. Absolutely the worst part are the relations between characters driven by kindergarten dialogues which are embarrassing to watch and listen.

This was one of the best TV shows you watch for comic book genre, It started of great well lit up scenes with loads of action, suspense and a good story-line, suddenly all of that was thrown out and made a weak series in which the main character reveals himself all the time and the action is terrible to watch, no suspense, no general direction of the character, in almost every episode its the same dialogue  Oliver if you want them to trust you, you should let them know who you are, and Oliver takes of his eye piece and says  I am the Green Arrow  L.O.L What Dafuq.The show is just going down hill, specially that now the main character is now Felicity (sleeps with all the Billionaires and take their fortune and keeps them under her payroll) worst character, Thea Queen 2nd billionaire famous line  I am out . Just keep the group small and the action hardcore like 1st season, identity reveal yeah stop that, let the character start killing again, and please don't bring dead people back to make their own show.Season 1 - Great. Season 2 - Just OK. Season 3 - What is happening.Season 4 - Why are you killing the show. Season 5 - I give up, cant watch anymore. Season 6 - Stopped watching.

The action of Arrow is awesome! but i feel that it has become a little boring because there is absolutely no humor, Felicity talks too much, and many other flaws. Thats why i give it a 4/10 rating. Otherwise, the series' action is perfect.#Flashfan

This show is amazing and it gets better each day . Season 6 is spectacular. This is the best DCTV show in the Arrowverse. The show matures and grows each year . The leads of the show are spectacular and their chemistry is legendary . Great cast . Great story. Got a hold of this show last year and if I had blindly followed the haters remarks online, I would not have tried to check it out on my own . Guess what ? The show is amazing !!

I really loved this show at first but its become very hit and miss as to weather an episode is any good or not. It started out great (8/10) it was kinda dark and ruthless but unfortunately the writers started emphasizing on the characters feelings way too much. Also the fight scenes although slightly better now became super cheesy and felt like I was watching power rangers around season 4.I really hope that they start focusing more on the villains and plot more again. Also it definitely wouldn't bother me if they killed off most of the annoying cast members.

The First Season Of Arrow is a Great Season, it doesn't even feel like a superhero show (in a good way) the action scenes and flash backs are great and look like a scene from Mission Impossible or Kingsmen! The villain is top notch, the emotion is there, absolute greatness. Sure, it stalls here and there but that's expected when you have to fill 23 hours. the first season is great 8.75/10 IMOThe second is best so far, Deathstroke is the best villain, other than him the villain of the week's are also great e.g. the doll maker and clock king. the flash backs are also the greatest 9.5/10 IMOthe third season is where things go downhill, till the mid season it was shaping up to be great but after  The Climb  It became really mediocre, Ra's AL ghoul was an okay villain and the finale was really anti climatic. 6/10 IMOThe fourth is the worst. there is realistic feel to it, Damien Dahrk is a magician while Oliver is only an archer/hand to hand fighter. Thus the stakes are raised too high also Schism is the second worst episode ever. 5/10 IMOThe fifth season is a revival and is the second best season, Prometheus is a phenomenal villain and the stakes have been taken down a notch (THANK GOD) the finale is the best episode ever of Arrow, the only bad episode was  Underneath  and its quite possibly the WORST EPISODE TOO. 9/10 IMOoverall you will have a blast with the first two seasons, will have to sit through the bore that is season 3 and 4 and will be hooked at season 5, HIGH HOPES FOR SEASON 6

Like with Smallville and The Flash I have not seen every single episode but on some occasions, I do watch this show but only when there is a crossover or a certain actor in a particular episode. Like Peter Stormare who did good acting as Count Vertigo for two episodes and Matt Ryan who was John Constantine for one episode which was very funny. I also think Stephen Amell did great as Green Arrow and Felicity Smoke is pretty hot like Cathlin Snow from The Flash is. It is an okay show but it is not as interesting or likable as The Flash or Smallville.

Every year Arrow is becoming more boring . 1st and 2nd Season of Arrow is very interesting great Story. But is seems after 2nd Season their are lack in Story Writing. Same old type of Stories Nothing new and interesting .As a fan of Arrow I am very disappointed and i expect more from Arrow.

The first 2 seasons of the show was amazing however after that it got stale and boring. I decided to give up less than half way through season 5. The flashbacks become uninteresting. The villains after 2 seasons are boring. Love story is soap opera material. Season 4 made the show unrealistic with the sci-fi magic. Arrow was more interesting when he was working alone without any sidekicks.

The first two seasons of Arrow were brilliantly done. The cinematography was illuminating, and it had a good plot. Somewhere along the line, though, the writing went south, and I know where we can point a finger to: Marc Guggenheim. It's bad enough that he killed off Laurel, but apparently, he wants another to take up the mantle. Rather than giving it to her Earth 2 counterpart, like any ordinary writer does, he gives it to a character named Tina Boland, whose real name is apparently Dinah Drake. Never mind that the real Dinah actually appeared before, and that she was Laurel's mother! I swear, I don't know how in the world these writers are able to find jobs. They suck at it. Then there's the Felicity relationship. Not a bad character, but when you focus on shipping these two together, when clearly, within the comic books, Green Arrow and Black Canary are an item from day one! And she constantly makes some of the most bone headed plays, yet Oliver never calls her out for it. He's such a wuss. He's not Green Arrow. Green Arrow is funny, witty and doesn't mope around. Stephen Amell is a good actor, but they should have stopped the whole Batman persona around Season Two or Three. They had a chance to make things right with Season Four, yet they come away from that one even worse. And they didn't even know who was going to end up in the grave. Really? You threw the grave plot line out there, without knowing WHO was going to end up in it? To this day, I still say William, Oliver's son, should have been the one who died. This would have made his fight against Damien Darhk much more personal. In fact, who wouldn't have wanted him to die? John Barrowman is a good actor, but they've lost all use for him. Oliver's excuses for letting him live fall flat when he sold out his son in exchange for protection. To me, that's unforgivable. I'm sorry, writers, but you have failed this show. If you want to keep me interested, fire the show-runners. Better yet, cancel the show, before you make things much worse.

From the first season I thought that this show was unique and had a lot of promise; it was full of intrigue and frustrating characters who seemed to be neither good or bad in a way contrasting to so many superhero films/series. To say how much I enjoyed the show in the first and second seasons I was thoroughly disappointed from there in and yet I stuck around for two more seasons. The worst things about the show was how repetitive the villains became and how easily supposedly dead cast members were somehow brought back to life. I just wish this show had finished at it's peak after season two!

I used to think Arrow was a great show until the first episode of season 3,that was when the show went downhill in my opinion.I first like seeing a dark version of the popular archer Green Arrow from DC Comics and seeing popular characters that were supporting characters of Green Arrow come to life in the Green Arrow's own dark story which seemed pretty interesting for the first two seasons.But when the show had it's season 3 premiere and it introduced Ra's al Ghul and more stories similar to other Batman stories started to be on the show,that's when the Green Arrow of the cw started to feel more like a parody and Felicity,his main love interest on The CW started to feel like her getting paralyzed and being named Overwatch was stolen from the story of how Batgirl/Barbara Gordon got paralyzed and got the nickname Oracle and fell in love with Batman.And I still can't believe the writers didn't mind killing of the Black Canary in season 4,who is the real main love interest of the Green Arrow and not Felicity Smoak.

The action scenes are excellent and the story line if you are fan of super heroes in comics but the relationships between them are like the bold and the beautiful!like an American or Turkish soap opera!!!so beautiful faces with so boring personalities!!laurel??pffffff so predictable and flat as a woman!only felicity keeps the level up OK it is not game of thrones to have complexity in the characters but why so flat feelings?? P.S are we serious???im in season 2 and it's getting worse the romance part is awful soryyyy I mean stupid!!are the comics like this???mr director please this is not a soap opera!! PS2 at the end season 2 was much better and the love story between felicity and arrow seems the only real one!i hope to continue like this!!manu Bennett great performance as in Spartacus,he is a great actor he made season 2 more interesting PS 3 I quit watching at season 4...it could be a good show but unfortunately the script and the production are poor and in the soap opera's level...that's why I lowered my review to 4/10 What a pity :(

I love superhero movies...I mean love em...I love Marvel and DC movies I do not have a favorite between the two I just love em both. I haven't read any comic books so I have to research origin stories and stuff. With that being said..The TV shows are a very different, which is to be expected. I still like some of em very much. Well I can safely say I really like the Flash. It is expected that superheros shows are cheesy I mean come on...sometimes the cheese on top makes it better. With that being said Arrow is to cheesy for me...I binge watch every show I watch and I watch a lot of shows (quite a range of em). The Flash, and Arrow do a lot of crossovers that is why I began watching Arrow so that I could follow that story line because of the cross overs. I am in to the 5th season and I just don't think I can I watch another a season. I will get through this one but my God! It is like the characters aren't growing at all. 5 yrs in to the season and Oliver is still the same whining, brooding woe is me character he was in season 1. How can he be so pathetic and at the same time be so cocky to think every thing that happens in the universe is some how his doing? Who is he GOD? The constant self torment, it is like be the Arrow or don't already! Kill or stop. At the same time every freaking season Thea has to go find herself. She loses sight of who she really is every season, come on. Who is writing this crap? Can she please find herself and be good? It has been 5 years what is going on? Of course there are the canaries. Can they just die or freaking live already? It is sooo ridiculous the same story written every season.The betrayals. How many times can Oliver MCQueen get betrayed by someone he trust before he learns to stop being an idiot? He is supposed to be the mayor and the Green Arrow protecting the city on two different fronts yet he is constantly trusting anyone who comes into his life and being played. Come on. A person has to have better instincts than that to run a city or be a super hero! This season with this new team!This new team is awful. I mean awful. There is literally 0 purpose for any of them to be with Oliver. They can't fight, they don't have any powers, their instincts suck. The only one that could do anything was the one with the suit that had power. Mr. Wonderful or whatever is good at tech stuff but who needs him when they have Felicity, except he is also good at being a punching bag. The Jason Voorhies want be is a terrible substitution for that other guy they had that Thea was dating (I am terrible at remembering names).I have started this season so I have to finish, but right now it is killing me. Every scene, and every episode so far is just so dumb.

Arrow piloted in 2012. I loved the first season. Oliver Queen returns from his island he was stranded on and decides to fight crime because of his father and to make Star City better so he becomes the vigilante known as the Green Arrow. The first season was amazing and had a great plot. Stephen Amell had quality acting and the actors for Felicity, Diggle, and Laurel are all good. So I thought it wasn't going to get better. It got better. Season 2 was much darker and was highlighted by a new villain. It contained more quality acting and more Oliver flashback scenes. So after that I loved Arrow. But it didn't last. Season 3 wasn't necessarily terrible but it lost something about the first 2 seasons that made it great. It had a different vibe and it just didn't have a great plot. Season 4 gets too supernatural and season 4 is a low point for the series and I didn't enjoy it that much. I reluctantly watched season 5 which initially isn't great but by the end it recovers from season 4s problems. I would recommend this show but it's not perfect. It does have some weaknesses but it's a good show at its best

I have watched four seasons, and this show has gone from great to fantastic! First of, I am not very familiar with the comic, but I have done some reading up post watching. The first season has a lot of introductions, explaining and character growth. The second and third season expands on this and while the good parts becomes better, the not so good parts starts to show more. Some say there is too much drama in the show, I say yes, there is drama, bu that makes the characters, motifs and bonds that much stronger any you get a real sense of what they are fighting for. By the end of the third season I felt like I was feed too much of an excellent meal, and really hoped there would be some changes until season four. I really got what I wished for! Oliver Queen finally starts to smile a lot more and leaves his previously troubled self behind. The chemistry between the characters is almost touchable and the fight scenes are simply amazing. Just watch episode 6 of season 4 for a great example. This particular shot just goes on and on without any cut. Simply breathtaking!Arrow is heavily tied to the Flash series so it is almost mandatory to watch them side by side in the right order. I personally don't mind this as I love Flash also.

Arrow is just the show, you'd watch, when you are bored to death. Aside from that, this has the best background story, you'll ever experience from a life series. On the other hand, it gets milked by the present to an extent, where it just gets boring.Judging by the book, the Author really made a poor job. The setting, acting and everything else was just so there was a barely standing hero-series. => Normal guy becomes hero, kills and arrests bad people and has all the women he wants.=> Bad people wanna kill him and the women, he looses the women. => Hero stops them. => Hero becomes hyped, kills and arrests more bad people and has all the women he wants.Looping all the way to the end of the series.This kind of reminds me of Superman mixed with Robin Hood and Batman.Sure, there are some parts where I laughed and really got hyped by the next episode, but comparing to others, these moments were minor in arrow. As the 3rd Season started, I suddenly felt, why this series has such a bad reputation. Everything went viral, to complete confusion. The impression I got, worsened and kept its pace.For everyone considering watching a mainstream Hero-Vigilante-RobinHood-Richguy-Series. Why not just watch arrow? Considering that: I dare you to watch past season 2.

If you're lucky you have yet to watch this horrible show. I have always really enjoyed arrow but I will admit the last couple of seasons were weaker so I am happy to say that season 5 Is a real return to form for the show. The premise of the season sees oliver queen attempt to train a new team of vigilantes in an attempt to stopping a serial killer while trying to be star city's mayor during the day. Stephen amell is oliver queen and he is absolutely fantastic in this role, he totally nails the character and you really empathise with him. At times his character goes through hard times and he totally sells the anguish that he goes through so well and this is probably his best season for a dramatic performance. The supporting cast is used better this time, felicity smoak played by Emily bett Rickards becomes a lot less annoying this season and was used perfectly in her role so she didn't take over the show like I believe she has in previous seasons. Out of the new team I really liked rick Gonzalez take on wild dog and once you learn more about his back story you really do sympathise with him and care about him. David Ramsey is once again back as john diggle and even though he has slightly less to do this season he does a great job in the role especially contrasting Oliver. Prometheus is the villain of the season and I really liked his character, he is a dark reflection of oliver and once his big reveal happens it is even better as you see these two character's going head to head. The story of the season is well done seeing oliver forming these new relationships with people and learning to trust them. Also as mentioned before I feel like the villain fed into the narrative very well and did the job well. Also I actually kind of liked the flashback storyline this season, don't get me wrong it's not as good as the first two seasons but it is pretty fun to watch. The script is really good because this is the darkest of the dctv shows so it's drama is heavily relied upon and I thought really well handled. When the humour is needed it also is done pretty well to help break the tension. The style like most seasons of arrow has great action scenes that feel very gritty and real that sucks you into it, I also really enjoyed the links to the first season that is a big theme of this season. However, my one criticism of this season is that there are a few filler episodes around the half way mark that deviate from the main plot and I didn't enjoy it as much. This is a truly fantastic season of arrow that includes possibly my favourite finale of any of the seasons and the whole season is a must watch for comic book fans.

Arrow is A DC TV Show of the superhero character Green Arrow,portrayed by Stephen Amell.I feel that Arrow is the best DC TV show,after which is Flash,Gotham and Legends of Tomorrow.Arrow has great actors,themes as well as good CGI and the villains are great.From Prometheus(portrayed by Josh Segarra-Best villain ever),Deathstroke(Manu Bennett),The dark archer(John Borrowman),followed by Ra' Al Ghul and Damien Darkh,the TV series is filled with action,drama and a little bit comedy.I highly recommend readers of this site to watch this show.However,the images of violence can sometimes be disturbing to some watchers.

Before The Flash, I started the Arrowverse with well, this. And certainly my initial impression for the 1st season was highly positive.It is true even in the comics that Green Arrow was Batman with bow and arrows, but through the decades it has it's own nuances. While Oliver Queen's character and motivation isn't as compelling as Bruce Wayne, Ollie became a relevant figure in the DC Universe.4 seasons in and this is where I believe the show succeeds; Arrow the TV show wasn't trying to copy Batman even though on the surface it seemed the same; it tried to be it's own thing and that it works (most of the time and where it counts anyway.)The show does have flaws particularly with regards to the writing on Oliver Queen's love life which is just distracting. I think this is due to the lack of motivation in Oliver Queen's character, something that even the comic book struggles with, so I can close an eye on it.But also due to this, the direction of the show can lose focus at times and not as well paced as it should be. Again, the writers are simply working with what they have and that's not a whole lot compared to the Flash, which is why you will also see some borrowed villains from established Rogue Galleries. The real tragedy here is that while the writers have done a good job in presenting an often forgotten DC hero to a new audience, they haven't been able to build new ground on existing Green Arrow foundation which admittedly, isn't an easy task.But in all intents and purposes, they've succeeded in making Arrow relevant again and that should congratulated.

The dialogue alone is disgustingly simplistic and common colloquialisms are misused or just downright opposite of their general meanings. If that isn't enough, the plot is ignorant of its own devices, which their writers seem to forget is what creates a believable and cohesive story line. I generally like well a designed super-hero story. This is neither well designed, nor is it  super-hero . It's more of  stupid-hero , oops I crapped my pants style of non-intellectual storytelling. I gave it 3 stars, because I almost made it through the first half of the second season. Alas, I could no longer accept the horrible dialogue, with so many new plot holes. TO THE WRITERS: you can't mask your incompetence, no matter how many sex scenes, or lesbian kiss scenes you place there to distract from your horrible stupidity, or your lack of understanding of common social behavior when speaking...out loud....to a f-ing audience. People like you are why the avg IQ is steadily dropping, thanks arrow writers...

Hi. The Arrow is a Hopeful TV Show Series and i prouded to Director of the this Series. I hope that in the feature we see more Simple TVShow Series and Movies like this to teach our feature children about Kindness, Hope, and other good things to do good and good living. Thanks.

I'm only in Season 4, and only watching it while waiting for something better to show up. If you enjoy soap operas but would like them spiced up with repetitive gloomy fight scenes, you'll probably enjoy Arrow. That's assuming you can tolerate interminable flashbacks, lots of whining, shouting and weeping, and almost no humour to break the tedium. There is a bit of magic and high tech wizz bang stuff, and one or two characters occasionally pop in to an episode to lighten the dark mood. However, overall the show is slow, repetitive, angst-ridden, and lacking the spark that other shows of its kind have. Some of the lead characters/heroes are portrayed as being quite stupid, too - that's down to the writers/producers I guess.It's the worst of DC and not a patch on Marvel.

This is the best superhero series that i have ever seen, good job guys!! I love it and can't wait to watch every episode. I was captivated since the release of the pilot episode in season one. The first season continued well, i loved the drama and the ways Oliver and his friends dealt with it. Don't get me wrong, I enjoy Arrow. But I can't love it. I'm a comic fan, not so much Arrow or most mainstream titles. I love the heroines, and this is where my gripe is..I'm a massive Batgirl fan and i mean all things Batgirl. Birds of Prey second favorite. ( The birds of prey generally consist of. Batgirl, Huntress, Black Canary) many more have filled in as well(Katana, poison Ivy for examples). I also collect Black Canary. The Arrow give's no respect to Dinah Lance.(the black canary). In the real Dc universe, the black canary is considered as one the best and feared martial artists, to such a degree that she holds her own against Batman and most hero's or villains for that matter, and has beaten Arrow more than once, and would take any character on that show..Earth 2 Canary is what most books are based on.. So when I see Felicity Joke being able to knock her out in 1 hit, it make's me wonder if the writers of Arrow even know about the characters they portray. The few episodes they had Huntress(Helena Bertinelli) Who's Batman's and Selina Kyle's daughter also from Earth 2.. Show's they just love throwing any characters in without any real thought.(Mad dog, Mr terrific.. Absolute Joke's) It's like portraying Captain America with a bazooka instead of his shield..Please start showing more respect for the great characters you portray....

This is one of my favourite TV shows of all time. At first, I was skeptical, and only watched it because I was watching Legends, and didn't get a few things. But I am glad I did watch. The first two seasons were bloody brilliant, a perfect ten out of ten. I loved the characters and the plots, and eagerly awaited each episode. Season three was a bit disappointing, at least some of it. The first ten episodes were good, Roy being the Arsenal was bloody brilliant, and I personally loved the new characters of Ray Palmer and Maseo. Yet the entire plot of Oliver becoming Ra's was pretty disappointing though. Season four was just bad. Really the only things I enjoyed in it were the Olicity moments, which in the end ruined the season. Season five has looked promising so far. The only problem I have is that Team Arrow is overcrowded, but I do like the new team. Prometheus is awesome, and it's been a pretty epic ride so far, and I'm looking forward to plenty more.

!!! This may contain spoilers !!! I will try to avoid spoilers but just in case... (because I hate spoilers myself). We try to find shows that already have seasons out because we binge-watch and I hate waiting for episodes. We started Arrow late last year and just finished season 4. I agree with several other reviewers about the first two seasons; great! We were hooked through he first two seasons. On that I have to give it a 9. It started going downhill on season 3.If you ever want to enjoy any of these action shows, you simply have to just ignore a certain amount of technical BS. The realities of physics and  it just doesn't work like that  that producers seem to ignore. The thing is that most of us with any sort of technical knowledge have to suffer through producers stupidity, but there comes a point when it becomes so bad that you just cant get past it. Who was it that said;  Truth is stranger than fiction because fiction has to make sense ? Arrow showed promise until there became more and more times I had to ignore stupid decisions from supposedly smart people and the all-to-common trauma to a persons body that you just don't recover from. Another reviewer complained; how do the arrows not come out of the quiver when he flips? that is ridiculous. I could easily design a quiver to hold the arrows -and there may be already some out there. However he also asked how it's possible Arrow pulls out exactly the tip he needs automatically with no apparent choosing? That is a valid question and is one of those things we are forced to overlook. Remember Hawkeye's revolving tip selector in Avengers? Excellent way to address that.Our family started criticizing the show at first for the stupid decisions, The fight scenes became noticeably amateurish and very poorly choreographed. I'm sorry but bringing people back from the dead (I'm talking dead and decomposing)is crossing the line for us. The show just went from being a great super hero action show, and turned into a soap opera complete with shoving gays in the face of my kids. Another thing is consistency. It started out that Arrow had some mad skills and would shoot weapons out of the hands of criminals. He did not hesitate. But it seamed the greater the villain, The more he lost that ability and everyone seamed to stand with there thumbs you-know-where (hesitating I guess for effect)as the villain performed his bad deeds. Too many opportunities were missed to keep you in the mindset that they were skilled operators.Season three was just questionable for us (like a 5 rating), but season four just completely went off the chain with soap opera, lousy fight scenes, stupid decisions and God-like powers leaving us feeling like we've been duped again, sucked in with a good show to hook you so you will sit through their psychotic thinking that they want to shove down your throat.Stop after season two and you will still think it's a good show. Three and four are just down in the gutter. I hope this is informative for you.

Before I begin my review, If you are interested in watching the flash / arrow or if you watched the flash. Arrow is the perfect option. It's such a good show full of twists when turns, plot twists and nail-biting moments. If you are deciding whether to watch flash or arrow first I would definitely say arrow as there are spoilers in flash regarding arrow. But this show is a great one. There is barely any humour it is more based on action scenes and intense moments with very view funny moments as the show revolves around a Arrow and him stopping criminals. So in conclusion this show is a great one full of moments that will make you gasp and blow your mind, But if you are looking for a more light-hearted show, this isn't for you. Ahmed

I was thrilled with the first two seasons even considering one of my favorite shows. I love the story and the action was entertaining. The main villain Deathstroke was a great villain in both the season and I think he is the best actor in this whole show. But after starting the third season and watching the season, I can say that it is absolutely terrible. The acting and dialogue is on par with Disney channel shows. The plot is so mediocre and in points I was laughing so hard at some of the scenes. Not because they were funny but because they are so terrible. I was even excited because I heard the main villain was Ra's al Ghul. I thought this would be the best season yet, but no I don't want to finish the season. After watching the 2nd season of Daredevil and going to this, it's obvious which is the better show (Daredevil). The positives I can give are the visuals and the villains are somewhat good. I questioned if I actually enjoyed the second season or if I was blind to good TV shows. The only reason I give this 4 stars is because the first two seasons are good and I would recommend you watch them both and skip the rest.

I rated this show 5 out of 10. 5 for being interesting to watch Season 1 and 2 but really went downhill from season 3 and 4. The plot was growing strong for the first 2 seasons but what annoyed me the most and made me want to quit this show was Laurel and Felicity.1) Laurel bitches way too much.AND... 2) Oliver has to put up with Laurel's nonsense and bitching after numerous times of being told not to do certain things which get them into trouble. 3) Apparently anyone can be a superhero with just weeks of training. 4) How does Laurel become the Black Canary when she only took boxing lessons? All of a sudden she has the courage to jump off 20 ft roof tops/ swing from buildings, grapple/kick, and learn mix martial arts in just a few weeks? I thought she was a freaken Lawyer man 5) Martial Arts acting really went downhill in season 3 and 4. 6) Felicity and Oliver love scene? The show really made a thing of them two, did they run out of ideas that they went from saving the city for Oliver's dad to falling in love and revolving the show around Felicity? 7) and apparently Felicity can hack into anything at anytime. I am almost done with Season 4 but only continued because I don't want to binge a different show on Netflix while I am still on this one...Also, Thea is hot but also falls under those who learned how to fight in just a short amount of time...

I can not but say that I am disappointed with this TV show. First season was quite awesome, all was fine, but then, it kinda lost its purpose and all was about making more money on action and action and action. I really dislike this. Good thing in this TV show was the start, the story, all was okay until some unreal things started to happen. Let me name all of those that I still remember: Oliver can do flips, rolls while no arrow ever fall out, Oliver knows exactly what arrow to take from his quiver even though most of them have different tip, he never draw his arrow first and then walk with it ready, instead, he walk with empty bow and then draws the arrow against several armed people who , as it seems, always miss him. How can a special forces team miss the guy with the arrow? The moment he moves his hand back to draw an arrow, special forces unit would kill him for sure in real life. OK, we get it, he is super fast archer even though it doesn't look like that. What else? He manages to kill the Ra's Al Ghul. This is so pathetic. Think about this, a leader of assassins talk to Oliver queen instead of simply killing him while he had a chance... That's so lame. Another crap moments were when unreal things started happening: Flash pops up, the CEO with super tech suit, Felicity who is obviously the master of everything and best hacker in the world. Please... If you want to watch this TV show, watch only first season, others are just NO.

OK first off I like the show mind you but I mean they show him all messed up in first part but now he wasn't even on the darn island. All 5 years they have him all over the place so why in the heck he so homeless looking. The time-lines are getting on my nerves as well 5 months later 12 Min's early I'm like Jesus stop already.Having said that he is a great arrow but some of cast selections really confused me. Plus now his new team I really don't like at all they need powers I say.I wish they stick with one thing instead of jumping also to flash and other shows I mean can't flash do good on its own don't really need to show it the parts don't even have anything to do with the main story lines its just added stupid parts.

I was skeptical about this series when I watched the 1st episode. I only continued to the next after watching the Flash's 1st episode where Arrow appeared with all his coolness. The following episodes were OK to watch doing something else in parallel, until I reached the 7th. There I was completely hooked and devoured everything including 3rd season, as soon as I could. The problems I had was with those annoying flashbacks. Even if there were some interesting stories, the past is the past and it is useless to cover half of the episode just to tell us how he learned to fight and make enemies. Still the action was interesting and the drama (when it was avoiding melodrama) was acceptable. Amell, Barrowman, for the guys and Law for the women were my favorite, the rest were OK, while I never liked snuffly Holland and omnipresent Rickards.The 4th season had really great potential and first episodes were very promising.  Ghosts  and Constantine were fitting very well, but suddenly the series lost its focus. Characters were not properly introduced, but were coming out of nowhere to make an easy finale for one and only episode etc etc. I'm now at s05e01 and although Arrow seems to return to his origins and the flashbacks are more delicate (missing 5 years, this should be the last season with flashbacks!, hopefully), we are already informed that his days as lone-avenger will be off soon. And I will stop watching because I don't want to see same story again and again. The only reason I might watch is to be informed about its status before cross- overs with other series. It's a pity because the character Arrow is much more interesting than Barry Allen

This show started off great from season 1, onto season 2, then it began to slow down a bit in season 3 and 4, but it picks up again with action in season 5. There are many story line build ups, and great flashbacks, and it also compliments with the action and fight scenes. One major critic of the show will be how the writers will often attempt to put in too many love sequences in a super hero show, another will be how the story doesn't follow up as well with the Green Arrow comics. If the show sticks to its action first and love story later, it will stay more consistent to what fans would love to see, and this will keep the show alive for a longer number of seasons. The best part of this show is that it provides its viewers with crossover episodes, and team ups with other super hero shows such as the Flash. These crossover episodes provides more action and delivers a comic book genre type of team up for fans or even non comic book fans to enjoy. On a side note, season 2 of this show is by far the best TV show season I have ever watched. Even if you do not have time watching this show, just watch season 2, you won't regret it.

Started out great, season 1 and season 2 were so good, I was so excited for season 3 but it was simply disappointing.Just when I thought it couldn't get any worse season 4 came out and proved me wrong. This show needs to be canceled. From a great superheroes show it became a cheesy boring soap opera that makes me wanna puke every time I watch it.Do yourself a favor and avoid this show. It's not even worth the first two seasons since it went downhill so badly. Thinking how great it was and how lame it is now makes me wanna cry, if I knew how bad its going to get I wouldn't have even started it in the first place.

As i don't want to write spoilers, i wont give many details. This is my opinion IMHO:The show starts quite good, i had fun for most of the first season. The second season was kinda meh, and had some lame parts, but was OK overall - that mirakuru stretch was just awful - BTW why didn't they invite bane? If you had hopes that the show could get better and not worse, wait for Season 3 where the story writing really goes downhill to a point that it's unwatchable, the chapters are 40 min long, moistly half of it is soap opera like talking and planing. Many things he could have done solo, now he needs the help of 2 or 3 friends just out of convenience (like fighting some random bad guy) Pretty much anyone can use a bow and arrow as its super easy (sarcasm), and also suddenly everybody becomes a fighter, even Thea - this is so lame! And BTW, oliver is a real jerk, he couldn't even give felicity the bottle of wine he promised in the first season (yes, this bothers me). Overall the directing is bad and amateurish, the show is very lame and stupid, inconsistent, has bad acting like a bunch of wax figures (mostly oliver and laurel) bad outfits, lots of clichés (like the bad guy that talks too much). Also the show is more like a soap opera and that got on my nervs - i don't'care about so many details of olivers sex life, of who is dating who, of all the flirting. Isn't this a superheroe movie? or is it a superheroe soap opera??I Coulnd't finish season 3, and i will not watch further.well, you get the idea right? if you like a smart and interesting show, with good writing and acting, skip this one.if you didn't already, then take a look at shows like continuum, chuck, torchwood, daredevil, burn notice (just to say a few).

Unfortunately, I would be heartless to give this film a zero star rating but that is about all it deserves,thinking of some people actually wasting time to do this saddens me. There are lots of things to criticize about Arrow starting from their inoriginality down to the excess exaggeration.What surprises me is how the producer did things that made me wonder if there was actual thought put in the production especially the death of Thea and the rise of Sara.Another thing that spoiled the series apart from the relationship with laurel lance was Laurel herself.She kept on doing things that were poorly thought to say the least,in addition to developing super fighting within such a short period.Luckily for we viewers I heard she died which automatically earns a plus on the producer side unfortunately the damage had been done. Irrespective they might actually have a shot to bounce back, Afterall aren't all superhero films enjoyable ?

Dear Oh Dear. I actually (unbelievably ) watched 2 whole seasons of this, because at first I thought it had potential, and the story was OK. I expected it to get better. It is a fantasy about a superhero, so I am happy to suspend disbelief and take it for what it's worth. But enough is enough ! The point it really lost me was not the bad acting, Beverley Hills 90210 type relationship drama or the rest of the criticisms thrown at this show. No, it lost me when EVERYONE ends up being a superhero too. Like his skinny sister who could hardly be strong enough to knock down a six year old takes martial arts lessons and after 6 months or less is an ace superhero herself beating up beefy bad guys. Then his girlfriend Laurel or whatever, ( also so skinny she could barely stand up in a strong wind, let alone get in a fight ), takes lessons at a boxing gym and after 3 months, hey presto, she becomes a masked superhero too, and is wiping the floor with bad guys. Impossible , I hear you say. No way , I hear you say. But no, the writers expect us to swallow that. Like another reviewer said, this could only appeal to 6 year olds, or people with low IQ.

(Warning: Spoilers!!!!!!!!!!!) Hi, my name is Thunderin' Tim and I'll be your reviewer today. So I started watching Arrow and after only 10 episodes felt the need to deliver a review to the millions of awaiting fans (cut to a scene with me behind a signing desk and nobody waiting in line). There is a fair set-up with lots of potential. There is a big flaw, many things I liked, and some smaller issues and flaws <U+0096>I will discuss it in this order so it's not all good or bad but a nice mix.Flaw <U+0096> Slow Down Brotha' Just relax a little. The pace is ridiculous. The first episode: Oliver Queen was in a boat accident and he stranded on an island with more stuff going on than Lost and he comes back after being presumed dead and he returns to the party life but is also a funky version of Robin Hood at night fighting crime whilst juggling a social life that includes his new step daddy, his wayward sis, an ambiguous mom, a best friend who possible slept with his former girlfriend, whose sister was his lover and died in the same boat accident and the girls' father, who's a cop, hates him and<U+0085>. Slow down please! I thought this and then I saw I only was 20 minutes into the show. It's not necessary, it feels rushed, and it doesn't give you time to really like or understand the characters.Good stuff <U+0096> Let's Kick Some Butt I like the Monster of the Week style of this early episodes because it reminds me of early Buffy, early X-Files and early Supernatural and that's not a bad thing. I like Ollie and the actor playing him. I dig Dig. Thea is insanely hot. I like the Queen Family dynamic. I like the fighting scenes, makes me want to beat someone up and then run away like a real super hero. I like the flashbacks to the island, and I especially like the crazy Asian dude on it. I like Felicity although I hope she doesn't turn out to be a Garcia from Criminal Minds character, who solves everything the same way every episode.Issues 1)Hypocrite: Queen suffers from HHH, and I don't mean the wrestler but Hollywood Hypocrite Heroism <U+0096>the disease that makes a main white male character judge people for doing the same as he (Jack from 24, Jack from Lost etc). This becomes clear when he is obsessively protective about Thea, who as a teenager goes to clubs, has love interests, and drinks (normal teen stuff). Queen hates it violently whilst himself having did half of Starling City and being a party boy from the same age. Then in episodes 7 and 8, he meets a girl, does her of course, and upon finding out that she kills bad guys, that are either Triade or Mafia, you know, what he has been doing EVERY EPISODE, he is morally outraged and tries to stop her. With what right? You do the exact same thing.2)She's your sister, you creep!: Ollie and Thea have a weird, almost flirty relationship. He's overly protective, threatens anyone who looks at her whilst being male, she's very touchy, even touching his scars and muscles. But the worst moment is when he catches her making out in a bra. The boy gets a three second warning before being drowned in a bucket of his least favorite soda, but Ollie keeps watching Thea whilst she redresses. Dude! If I walk in on my sister like that I will leave and apologize, or tell the dude to get lost WHILST AVERTING MY GAZE. Not look at her like a pervert.3)Less Than Zero: The BFF character is nice and all, although the 2 of them look like they left the pages of a Bret Easton Ellis novel, but he gets so little background I found him rather useless. Yes he slept with Laurel, and yes he's Ollie's BFF and yes his father cuts him off, but none of it tickled my senses.4)Give me the D: Ollie casually informs him that he knows who killed Dig's brother; informs him how he knows; and informs him he already killed him with all the intensity of debating the baseball results you don't really care about. It's his brother, tell him sooner and better.5)Go back to Ferguson!: the cop character, Laurel's father, is annoying the hell out of me. You're not Riggs from Lethal Weapon nor do you have his goodwill-factor, so take a chill pill.6)Leather Locklear ( High Five!  I shout to an empty apartment): out of all fabrics used to make clothing, the worst one when you expect to do more movement than an Olympic Gymnast, is leather. Why not wear cotton or silk since it gives you much more moving room? DC's and Marvel's obsession with putting hot guys in tight leather outfits brings up some awkward questions.Preliminary conclusion: I like Arrow but it will not make Top 10 List. It doesn't intrigue me like X-Files or Californication. I sort of miss the DC feel to it. There are good characters and some nice acting, set design, special effects, and story line, but it also feels rushed and at times, times which call for passionate acting, weirdly passive and muted. The women in the show look fine, as do the guys I would imagine. It looks sharp and high budget. I'm highly curious where it's all going. There are many flaws and slight annoyances, like everyone being either good or bad and Hoodie rarely missing where other highly trained bad guys miss more often than early Stormtroopers. And everyone let's Ollie get away with way to much stuff, but all in all I like it and it didn't put me off and I will keep watching it to see what will happen.Will come back later

This show USED TO be great!!!At the moment i am at the end of the 3rd season and i think i won't be watching the show any more. Writers have been doing their job very poorly and there are many flaws!IF ANYTHING CAN RESCUE THIS SHOW IS FLASHPOINT! AND I MEAN IT! JUST GO BACK AT LEAST AT THE HALF OF THE THIRD SEASON WHEN NO ONE KNOWS AND ALL THAT STUFF WITH THE POLICE, IF IT IS TOO MUCH TO GO BACK FURTHER. IT WILL MAKE SHOW GREAT AGAIN!There is no need for other side kicks than Arsenal!Only Arrow, Diggle, Felicity and Arsenal! Please !

The series starts off on a high but keeps falling to new low as the new seasons come in. When the show was only about an arrow drawing vigilantly, it used to be fun, but each new season introduces ludicrous plot. Now we have super humans, magic, people returning from dead and lots of stupid script and plotting. Season One <U+0096> Introduces us to Oliver Queen aka Arrow, didn't know much about him although a lot of parallels could be drawn with Batman. This season has strong plotting, intriguing story, witty humor & good cinematic action sequences. The acting starts on a low but the cast find their feet by the end of the season. (8/10)Season Two <U+0096> It's about the reformed non killing Arrow & the story supports the agenda perfectly. Lots of character development for the supporting cast making for an overall better team, we get to see a lot more of DC universe and it look promising, we get cameos of the Flash & the Suicide squad. The plot revolves around a Demon from Arrows past, the intrigue of past made for a fun watch. The bad guy in this season was probably the perfect antagonist to the Arrow. Besides being a better actor, his presence and skill were just superb. The finale of the season did get overblown with the introduction of superhuman and the ending was not as strong as I had expected, still a superior season than the first one. (8/10) Season Three <U+0096> Starts on a high then loses itself until an exceptional mid season episode of a dual high up in mountains and then spirals down for a new low by the end of the season. The way League of Assassin was used turned out to be a botched up job. This season had better actors & acting just the script and plotting were terrible. The policy of not killing a non-reform-able mass murder was so frustrating. (5/10)Season Four <U+0096> The plot was ridiculous, spoiled it all for me. Enjoyed the cameos of Flash, Vixen & Constantine but the guys from Arrow itself had only self-pitying or obnoxious roles. The show has turned into a romantic soap-opera having good action sequences. (3/10)

A Nolan-Esque show that managed to balance comic book vigilantism and family drama simultaneously that sadly became relationship orientated, outweighing the comic book elements that were much loved. Season one and two are by no means perfect however definitely provide enjoyment to both comic book fans and the general audiences alike. Darker, gritter and cliff hanger filed Arrow set the trend for most comic book shows to come. Dealing with themes that include; Redemption, Identity, Addiction, Trust and so much more the show manages to feel fresh while recycling the that of what has already been done. Unfortunately season four does not follow its predecessors, even though the second half of season three was a large step-down from the prior seasons, it still manages to be one of the worst comic book show seasons to date. Filled with pointless story lines, aimed to prop up and centralize a relationship, introduce meaningless characters and create even more relationships. Hopefully the fifth season can bring back what once was.

Review of Season One: I'm no huge superhero fan so it's with some trepidation that I sat down to watch ARROW, my first fully-fledged superhero TV series. The good news is that I ended up liking it, although I wouldn't say love. The series is flawed by being overlong and endlessly dragged out with trivial plot points and villain-of-the-week story lines, but it still has an interesting set up and lots of good stuff to counter the bad.One of the main problems I have with the show is Stephen Amell as the protagonist. I find the guy a conceited jerk, his arrogance extremely off putting, and that opinion only cemented itself as the episodes went by. On the other hand, David Ramsey gives a strong turn as Arrow's sidekick Diggle, and Paul Blackthorne is very believable as the weary cop on his tail.The show has a bit of an odd format whereby half the scenes are told in flashback, exploring Arrow's history on a desert island where he gets involved with some renegade soldiers. These flashbacks lack impact because they've already taken place and are kind of shoehorned into the main, present day narrative. But they do allow for a couple of cool actors, namely Byron Mann and Manu Bennett, to do cool stuff, so I didn't mind too much. ARROW is an easy show to watch because action scenes are inserted into every episode and the action is choreographed as it should be: violent, hard-hitting, and fast-paced; it doesn't disappoint. It's a more than watchable show, which is why I'll be coming back for season two.Review of Season Two:Season Two of ARROW is firmly in the category of 'more of the same'. It follows exactly the same template as the successful first season, with the main story told chronologically alongside various flashbacks to Arrow's time on the desert island and his interactions with Slade Wilson (the great Manu Bennett, still the best thing in the show). The contemporary material has more of a story arc feel to it here, less villain of the week, more building towards something big.The action scenes are quite fun, although repetitively staged at times and always seeming to take place in the dark, which gets a bit annoying. I didn't like the last episode, which utilises confusing choreography and time-swapping to poor effect, but otherwise this show is pretty decent. I'm still no fan of the main actor but the supporting cast are fun and you get people like Colin Salmon and Summer Glau turning up just to show you how it's done.

We all know who Bruce Wayne is, Who Clark Kent is, and who Diana Prince is but not many are familiar with who Oliver Queen is. After you watch this show you will definitely remember the name Oliver Queen. I truly love it when comic book companies make a great TV series with a character who previously wasn't as famous and well known as they were prior to the TV show. Arrow is a great show that explores DC's darker side. The Dark Knight also know as Batman has some of his greatest enemies cross paths with The Arrow, which ends up with both men having to fight till death. Some villains discover who The Arrow truly really is under the hood and that puts his friends and family at great risk. Oliver Queen also known as The Green Arrow is one of my new favourite comic characters of all time. For the record before this TV series was even released I had no clue who Oliver Queen or The Green Arrow was. I owe the creator and cast of this show a big high five and hug for doing such a great job in bringing a not so familiar name to the small screen. Some of you may say  but hey I know Oliver Queen/The Green Arrow, I have seen him in a animated series as a kid growing up  Well the unfortunate part is that not many people have seen the animated series where Batman and The Green Arrow fight side by side to stop crime in their cities. This show does not lack in action, comedy or deep emotional moments. It has everything it needs to be one of the best DC TV series today. From season 1 to now you truly have the privilege to see Oliver Queens mindset and views on life drastically change after each new experience he encounters. Whether The Green Arrow dodges death or saves his city once again Oliver Queens life will never truly be normal. Everyone he loves and truly cares for will always be at risk. Arrow starts off as a realistic crime TV series but then later on develops into a true comic book masterpiece. Comic book TV shows have always been around even when some of us didn't even exist. Arrow truly put DC Comics on the map with this great show. The Flash and Legends of Tomorrow wouldn't even exist if it wasn't for The Green Arrow. It truly started something great for DC in the TV industry. Comic book fan or not, Arrow is for an audience all over the world. Before this show I had no clue who The Arrow was and why they would make a show about a comic book character who not many are familiar with. It makes all sense to me now... Introducing new characters from comics we no longer have so much access to is a great way to expand the DC universe and get new fans to adore a character who has been hidden or over shadowed by other superheroes. In my honest opinion I strongly suggest viewers to give this show a chance. You wont regret it. Some comic book fans are probably already sold way before reading a review or seeing a trailer online which is a good thing as this show definitely does not disappoint . But to those who have no knowledge of the DC comic book world please don't get discouraged as this show is literally for anyone. Comic book geek or not this show truly makes you want to see more and more after each episode. Arrow started it all when it comes to DC's TV series success and believe me it will continue for many more years to come. I truly hope people watch this show. They are in store for an amazing experience :)

'Arrow'd'. A show being Arrow'd means it went from being great, to utterly terrible. Arrow has been Arrow'd. Remember when Arrow was easily one of the best Superhero TV shows ever? And was even one of the most quality shows on television? When the writing was gritty, mysterious, and left you wanting more? When each character would enter the show, they'd bring a new and dynamic approach? How every villain would differ from the other? If you don't remember that, then you probably started watching after s2. And for that, I sincerely apologize.Now let's get down to business. Arrow used to be great. Hell, Arrow used to be a lot of good things. Now there isn't a positive thing to say. The writing is below par, the story lines, the plots, character and/or development are all terrible. Felicity isn't the problem, it's the writers. Guggenheim & co. They took a very good character, and milked the absolute crap out of her. Felicity Smoak should of NEVER been a main character. She was at her best when she was only supporting. Characters like Felicity should never be main characters on Superhero shows. Soap Operas & drama's? Hell yes, for sure. A character that brings nothing more than romance, and Soap Opera-type drama should never of even touched Arrow. Now the overall writing. It's bland. It's cliché. It's BORING. We are COMIC BOOK FANS. We don't come here to cry over relationships, or intend to see 40 minutes of pure drama. We come to watch Green Arrow beat up bad guys, save his city & just be downright awesome. (Keep in mind, this review is for the present Arrow, s3 & 4. S1& 2 is a whole different ball game.) And lastly, the acting. Let's talk about the god damn acting. Back in the golden age of Arrow, we experienced good acting. We were drawn into the characters, the actors made us genuinely care about them. Amell was strange, dark & mysterious. He was destroyed inside. Bennett was brutal, he was menacing. He never let up. We wanted to hate him, but Manu's dynamic ability to show us so many sides & layers to Wade Wilson was phenomenal. Now we get sub par level acting. No dynamic abilities. No layers. No thought provoking performances, or performances that make us go  OH MY GOD . It's the type of acting you expect from a crappy Romcom. And ironically enough, it's the sort of acting that you expect from a Soap Opera. Overall Arrow really doesn't deserve the popularity it's still getting. It's a clear & utter cash cow of a project. Passion & dedication completely went out of the window when Kreisberg & Berlanti left and gave Guggenheim control. Nobody is involved with Arrow that actually cares about anymore. Writers & actors alike. Now all it is, is a shell of its former self. A show completely destroyed & ripped to pieces by itself. 1/10 DO NOT WATCH S3, S4. I highly recommend watching S1 & 2. Those seasons were amazing. Also, I don't recommend tuning in for the upcoming seasons. I have no faith in Arrow anymore. Tune into other shows. I highly suggest Netflix's Daredevil. Daredevil is the sort of show that Arrow would of been if Guggenheim was nerve given complete control. Hell, Daredevil is even a step up from the early Arrow seasons.

Arrow is a show that has a lot of meaning to it that included in each episode. You can take many things from watching this series but more than that you are able to see over the period of this series the sacrifices that Oliver Queen must make in order for the greater good. In order for him to save the city he has to be more than a man but by doing that he has to become less human. The meanings from this series can be taken out and applied to real life situations. That in order to achieve a certain goal you will need to make certain sacrifices. During the duration of this series you are able to see how Oliver Queen has developed as a person and as a hero and sometimes lines are crossed for the greater good. By doing so however you are able to see the differences of how Oliver Queen handles such setbacks. The realistic part of this show is that if you choose the life of a crime fighter people will always get hurt and may even die and that even though you wear a mask your loved ones are still in danger.

I love this show, always have, always a will, it's what first got me into watching live action comic book to shows and films. Everyone's character is awesome, and as long as Oliver and Felicity aren't going through any drama, him having a happy, healthy relationship is a fresh touch too. What I can't stand is Laurel's character, I hope Katie Cassidy is nowhere near a self-indulged/obsessed moron in real life cause it just means she's a tremendous actress. Someone could be going through the final stages of their death and Laurel would be there to say  but how do you think this makes ME feel? . You can literally predict when she's gonna be self-obsessed because she makes almost all topics about her. I want you to play a game for me, well two games. 1. Drink every time she manages to swing a subject so she becomes sub-topic, and 2. To be honest, the first half of season one was slow, but after that, this has become one of my favourite t.v. shows to date. It's stories are strong, characters interesting, (except Moria and Thea and thanks for offing her at the end of season 2 Slade) and some of the awesomest action sequences this side of The Walking Dead! If you don't know a lot about the comic story lines published by DC, that's no issue. They don't really follow any stories from the comics which is my only real complaint. Anyhow, this show is awesome and you should check it out! It's entertaining in all the right ways that a superhero show should be. I can't wait for it to return.

After an OK first season this show didn't start to go down, it fell of a cliff. The directing is not great and while season one had some good fight scenes things got worse and worse as the show went on. I started watching this show in a rather a circuitous way. I was watching Flash, which I really enjoyed and in one of the Flash episodes, I came across some Arrow characters. My 14 year old son suggested that I watch Arrow first. I just finished all 3 seasons (69 episodes) on Netflix and compelled to write this review.The first season was sort of fun and crisp moving. Having said that, what started as a  Super hero  show turned out to a day time soap Opera of a dysfunctional family with debauchery, stupidity, ambiguity & just plain O'l dumbness all around. So, why did I watch all the episodes? Simple, the female characters in this show are smoking hot!!. Willa Holland as Thea queen, Katie Cassidy as Laurel Lance, Emily Bett Rickards as Felicity Smoak to name a few.Now, let's talk about some of the characters in the show. I promise that there are NO SPOILERS. 1) Oliver Queen (Stephen Amell): The main character (i.e. Arrow). Good looking and very handsome, no doubt. However, he is little slow witted. Starting season 2, he does not want to use lethal force and that repeatedly comes back to bite him in the a**. I am not a violent person, however in some situations as a supposed savior of the city, you have to use lethal force2) Laurel Lance (Katie Cassidy): Oliver's girlfriend and a wannabe vigilante. How can anybody be so dumb and be a vigilante without any training. She gets her beautiful ass kicked repeatedly. She is really hot and her curves are kicking.3) Thea Queen (Willa Holland): Oliver's spoiled little sister and is a real babe. Her mid riff is absolutely gorgeous. I don't want to talk about her more and give away some surprises.4) Felicity Smoak: Blond and brainy (that is not an oxymoron). I just adore this character. She is funny, chirpy and touches your heart with her double entendre sentences.

The struggle for redemption, forgiveness and becoming a better person. This is what this show is all about. Throughout every season, Oliver's desire to keep his city out of danger is tested but as always, he manages to overcome anything thrown his way. This take on DC's 'Green Arrow' keeps you hooked throughout every season and never leaves a moment of action-packed ass- kicking. There are, however, some episodes that do let you down but, 'Arrow' does not disappoint and keeps you at the edge of your seat every time.Playboy Oliver Queen (Stephen Amell), decides to go on a trip with his father. But after an accident, he gets stranded on a mysterious island called Li-An-Yu. After five years, he returns to Starling City as a reformed man. But Oliver is back with an agenda - to get rid of all evil poisoning his city... with the help of a bow and arrow. What ensues is Oliver's on-going battle with his own inner-demons whilst punishing those who is a threat. With the help of his friends, John Diggle (David Ramsey), Felicity Smoak (Emily Bett Rickards) and Laurel Lance (Katie Cassidy), Oliver learns to manage his break down his own walls and work as the vigilante known as 'The Green Arrow'.Amell's portrayal as the newly reformed Oliver Queen intrigues you instantly and makes you wonder about his story and his motivation. His right-hand man John Diggle quickly becomes a brother-figure to him which Oliver takes time getting used to. Ramsey's performance of the ex- military is great and acting as 'the voice of reason', provides the viewers an insight into the rational side of a catastrophe. Emily Bett Rickards as Felicity Smoak is just... the perfect casting. Her as the bubbly I.T girl is amazing and her ramblings distracts you from the action - only if it's for a few moments. Katie Cassidy as Laurel is great too and as Oliver's ex, definitely is an example of how an ex should be... supportive and a great friend.The first season, as are all first seasons in every show, is the introductory one where you get to know the characters and what their agendas are. So you don't get to see much. But, the subsequent seasons takes you down a darker route, where Oliver's main goal is one thing and one thing only - making sure Starling City is a save place to live. The flashbacks does take you away from the primary story, which can be frustrating, but manages to give an insight into what happens to Oliver when he is stranded on Li-An-Yu. Overall, I think you can give this show a chance. The dark tones are refreshing and there are some comedic moments which provides relief, so you don't feel depressed after watching an episode.

Living in a mansion that he probably leased from Bruce Wayne.My favorite and most anticipated moments in the show are the flashbacks to the island where Oliver was marooned on for 5 years. It's got a  lost  feel to it and it keeps me somewhat curious and wanting more.But the show itself? They could do better. It's more cartoon-like than it is dark.

I just watched the end of the season 4 and I feel so big sorrow how good serial can go to hell. There are many good serials which in last couple of years show up. From Flash, Gotham, Marvel line to Arrow and all have one fatal flaw; when they start they are very well prepared and great on storyline, believability and pace<U+0085> in many of them second or latest third series the strain on fast creation and script writing with checking if it has even a logical continuity goes to hell.That's when you watch the last couple of parts of season 4 you are just thinking it would be more merciful if the show just ended. Brilliant story telling were replaced by long reminiscences of being or not being guilty. Commander who send's their troops against main villain which in the end is the level of all powerful, just knowing they are going slaughtered. Spartan who as ex-soldier is having complete break down and do not follow any orders (in general ever). The mighty Arrow who goes to make a speech to people on street which magically save the day {when in normal day most of the people would not even care}. Magical hacking which sends something to infinite loop, which ends in 24hours. Pathetic  Spiderman end cliché  when in the most crucial moment fighting the main villain people start throwing stones<U+0085> Damien Dark who by the way in blink of the aye killed approx. 20 people and evaporate bullets; controlling by mind things miles away - cannot kill that one pathetic person.Arrow when started was great show, amazing even. Now it's a pathetic sentimentality rewind of all possible cliché which were ever written and can be repeated on weekly basis just to get the show running.

After achieving dizzying heights in season 2 everything fell apart. Admittedly season 3 wasn't too bad, but season 4 was forgettable and regrettable that I wasted so much time watching it, hoping that it'd eventually get better but that hope turned into a despair with each episode.Put it short, what once was a crime fighting super hero show that was both fun and exciting has now been turned into as laborious ill fated love drama which seem to be intentionally catered towards girls rather than faithful fans of previous seasons. For this reason, there seem to be a trend of girls giving high ratings for the season 4, citing their love for Olicity...If I wanted to watch self centred girls exercising girl power in the form of bossing your loved ones and accusing them at every opportunity of some ill doing and lying, then I'd watch Sex and the City. And yet this is what happens in just about every episode of Arrow season4, with Felicity being its main instigator, who is about a couple of steps away from boiling a bunny. I can understand what the writers are trying to do, create strong female character equal to Arrow, but this isn't the way to do it, they couldn't have made a worse example of it. There is no need to get into how awful the Felicity character has turned into this season, many have mentioned that already, but one cannot get away from the fact that she represents everything that is terrible about season 4.I have no idea what's in store for season 5, but anything short of killing off Felicity will probably mean the continuation of the same drab that was the season 4, and what a shame that would be to completely ruin what once was a great show.

Creating live-action comicbook adaptations comes with a risk. For starters, you begin the game with the racial bonus of a big, rabid fanbase. Of course, the mass and the degree of rabidness here are direct functions of popularity, and if you decide to work with a rather obscure title, the bonus reduces accordingly. On the other hand, this also sort of imposes a certain responsibility on the creators, as they are compelled to pander to the existing fanbase by way of peppering the flick with lots of fanservice, avoiding plot twists which would send the fans into a berserker rage, and so on. Choosing not to limit yourself with the guidelines set by the original work is akin to choosing not to play your half-orc as a barbarian. Feasible, but wasteful. The bigger the fanbase, the bigger the waste. So, there you have it, a double-edged sword.Arrow is a reimagination of the popular DC franchise, the Green Arrow. A reinvention of its rather famous characters and recreation of major story lines. And a whole other slew of new-age terms which mean,  Okay, we can still milk the heck out of this cow; all we gotta do is start with a story, tack names from the comics on our characters, and make stuff up as we go, calling this a Green Arrow adaptation all the way. May sound harsh, but the truth is, the producers decided to start out with a half-orc mage, and the characters and setting bear scant resemblance with the original comic, even after four seasons and all those comments over how they will grow closer to their classic counterparts as the series goes on. Apparently the producers thought they could do what Nolan did with Batman and tried to make a show based on classic superhero fantasy but without the fantasy. That obviously did not do, however; avoiding spoilers here, the series began including more and more surreal elements after the first season, so maybe that is what them creators meant by bringing the show closer to its roots. But this Oliver Queen still has nothing to do with the playful, charming Ollie the fans know and love. Due to all the brooding and grit, people compared him to Batman rather than Green Arrow. I call bogus. He straight-up started out as the Punisher. He is just barely growing out of it.So why 8 out of 10? Because it is jolly good fun. And suspense. The writing is not Shakespearean, but all these twists and turns and cliffhangers always keep you on your toes and make for an all-around entertaining experience. The flashbacks allow for organic character development, actually displaying why who is doing what at the present, making sense of decisions by showing where people come from, or even sometimes characters coming to understand the lesson the flashback scenes taught them back then. Coincidences may appear to come out of nowhere at times, though, but they are excusable for the most part, owing to the fact that every comicbook story needs the odd deus ex machina here and there. Dramatic conversations, however...well, the dialogue comes across intolerably cheesy and forced more often than not, prompting you to yell,  Oh, for the love of...  But then they go back to the action, and the action is pretty good. The production quality is on par with a typical action movie, and yes, I am talking theatrical release here.Faithfulness to the source material be damned; these folks are telling their own story and they are doing a darn good job about it. So if you are just interested in good old popcorn entertainment, promise yourself not to cry  What have they done to my Ollie? And where is the beard?!  and get on it. Oh, yeah. No beard. Sorry about that. Only a stubble. Does it count as a spoiler? Because I am not checking the spoiler tag just for the beard.

Season 3 was mediocre, but season 4 has a huge drop in quality (shoutout to Marc  Franchise Slaughterer  Guggenheim). If you are a fan of the series, do yourself a favor and stop watching. The Flash is really hitting it's stride if you're desperate for CW superhero shows. This season of Arrow is just a crudely stitched together collection of tumblr fanfics. The characters have lost any real personality, and just serve to move the plot forward (this season is plagued by writers using half- baked concepts to push the  plot  forward by brute force). They frequently make decisions that defy any form of logic as well as any character traits of note. Any development that the characters have made in the past seasons has just disappeared, seemingly because they oppose Guggenheim's Mary Sue couple. Also it would be a misconception to think that the villain is the basis of any overarching plot. He's just a side note to said couple. Really this season seems to lack any direction whatsoever. It's like the writers are giving up on trying to provide any cohesive story. And to make it worse, while they could look back to some of the source material for some good ideas, they spit in its face in favor of their own rambling mess.As a side-note, I feel that the length of this show has been a huge detractor from the start. Even in it's glory days, the seasons probably could have been trimmed in half or lower and tell the same story. A lot of the time on this show is wasted on silly stuff, and could it could be a huge improvement to trim down the story to something more concise and save more for the effects budget. But honestly, is nobody in the studio checking up on them? Was this really looked at and approved by real people in the entertainment business? It boggles my mind that this could make it to air on such a well known show. The CW's superhero shows have always been aimed at a more  teeny  audience, but at the levels that Guggenheim has taken it to, it seems like he would be better off writing those fanfics and letting someone with moderate respect for the story's integrity take over. I love the actors in this and wish them the best, but the only hope I can see for this show is to retcon this season and get a fresh team of writers because this may be the biggest train wreck I have ever witnessed make the air.
